attributes.action: Not agree to implementation of Article 27 of the Treaty on the European Union (Consolidated version,amended by the Treaty of Lisbon) without a formal process of public consultation both within the UK and across Europe.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Lisbon Treaty amends the Treaty on the European Union such that Article 27 of the Treaty on European Union provides for the establisment of the new European External Action Service, an EU diplomatic corps, to be decided by the European Council. Our Prime Minister should not agree to a decision on this far reaching part of the Lisbon Treaty without formal and meaningful public consultation within the U.K and he should call for the European Commission to do the same. The Lisbon Treaty should not have been ratified without a referendum but since this has happened, key provisions such as Article 27 should not be decided without the soliciting of the general publics views.
